content.description: Start with your right hand on a light-colored sloper just above the bottom edge and midway across the boulder, your left hand on a decent edge a few inches in from the tip of the nose, and your feet below. Move your left hand directly to the nose ridge, and adjust your feet and hands until you can continue up the nose ridge to top out.
content.location: This is on the side of the Schnoz that you first see as you approach the boulder. It is on the right-hand side if you are looking directly at it.

content.description: Start with your hands in two good pockets that are situated along the bottom of the problem and your feet below on okay rock. Move your right hand out to the nose ridge, and get it as high as you can. Cut your feet, and get your right foot high to smear on the tip of the nose. Layback and struggle your way to victory.
content.location: This is on the left-hand side of the Schnoz Boulder. As you approach, this is on the far side that has what looks like a large, rounded eye at the top of the nose.
